columns: The School Board’s Capital Improvements Plan (CIP) is a ten-year plan that identifies the capital needs of

data.The School Board\u2019s Capital Improvem: the school system including new facilities, additions, modernizations, major maintenance, technology
upgrades, and other projects costing $100,000 or more. The plan is presented to the School Board for

columns: their review and comment, then shared with the Frederick County Board of Supervisors for inclusion in

data.their review and comment, then shared wi: the County’s CIP document. For easy reference, the top three projects in the School Board’s Proposed CIP
are listed below in order of priority:

columns: Fourth High School – High schools are currently at 117% capacity, and growing; assumes 257,000

data.Fourth High School \u2013 High schools a: square feet of new construction; 1,250 student capacity; 1,650 core
Armel or Middletown Elementary Expansion – Southeast portion of the county is growing and
over capacity; assumes addition of 23,640 square feet
Jordan Springs Elementary Expansion – Northeast portion of the county is growing and over
capacity; assumes 10-classroom addition (12,500 sf) and a gym addition (4,297 sf)
